transcript: right the French troops amid the smoke of their campfires, the greater part of whom were evidently in the village it- self and behind the hill. To the left from that village, amid the smoke, was something resem- bling a battery, but it was impossible to see it clearly with the naked eye. Our right flank was posted on a rather steep incline which domi- nated the French position. Our infantry were stationed there, and at the farthest point the dragoons.
